c625fb56-d8da-4341-890e-bf7c3a2c9d53.description: The course objective is to provide knowledge of psychological theory, principles and terminology. fd3ab843-eacc-4ae1-ba41-b1f1957f4cbc.description: The course objective is to provide knowledge about the function and structure of American Government, answering questions such as: What functions does a government perform? 64dc2742-f8f4-4fe9-9bc3-682695b20880.description: The course objective is to provide a comprehensive overview of foundational concepts in Pathophysiology. Emphasis is placed on the following core topics: cell biology; hematology; the cardiovascular and respiratory systems; the renal system and fluid/electrolyte mechanisms; neurology and the musculoskeletal systems; the gastrointestinal system and nutrition; the endocrine and reproductive systems; and clinical applications related to various systems.
64dc2742-f8f4-4fe9-9bc3-682695b20880.name: Pathophysiology (DLSI-0028)

b3bad122-a517-455e-b97c-8864064b5cb1.description: The course objective is to teach a brief history of beer and wine, as well as how it is made, provide an understanding of beer and wine varieties and how they should taste, and provide an understanding of food pairings for beer and wine styles.

1a5cecb0-73c8-4742-a80f-4dc72f3ec085.description: The course objective is to teach brief history of beer and wine, as well as how it is made. Students will develop an understanding of beer and wine varieties and how they should taste. We will also cover food pairings for beer and wine styles. Cultural elements and impact of beer and wine will be discussed, as well as its impact on pop culture.

5f95d749-2dce-4c70-87f9-d10595741b9a.description: The course provides an introductory survey of the economic concepts that are commonly used in understanding economic issues at the aggregate, or national level, with the emphasis on examining the overall functioning of the economy, exploring and understanding such phenomena as gross domestic product, national income, unemployment, inflation, the business cycle, fiscal and monetary policy tools, and international economics, exchange rates, international trade and balance of payment.
5f95d749-2dce-4c70-87f9-d10595741b9a.name: Introduction to Macroeconomics

issuer.summary: issued by Distance Learning Systems Inc.

3641ac4f-cc12-4fc8-9b0c-6a3525ecdcff.description: The course objective is to provide a comprehensive overview of core concepts in Microeconomics. Emphasis is placed on basic economic concepts such as: the interactions of supply and demand in any market; the nature and functions of product markets and input factor markets; the theory of consumer choice; the analysis of firm behavior under different market structures; the impact of market failure on social welfare; and the positive and negative potential of government tax and regulatory policy.
3641ac4f-cc12-4fc8-9b0c-6a3525ecdcff.name: Introduction to Microeconomics (DLSI-0025)

f1987663-93d0-4593-88d9-b204fc731d39.description: The course objective is to provide a comprehensive overview of core concepts the Apostle Paul’s life and ministry. This course was produced from a “Faith Based” perspective. As religion is a very personal subject, your perspectives, beliefs and interpretation of this literature may or may not align with the concepts shared herein.
